results.title: A Woman of the outback
results.creator_credit: Gian Manara, Asian Broadcasting Union and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Robyn Ingram lives and works with her husband and two small children on an isolated sheep station 200km. from the nearest town, Wentworth in N.S.W. The program observes Robyn at work on the farm, as teacher to her small children and on brief visits to friends on a neighbouring farm and in the city, and speculates on the pluses and minuses of such an isolated life. Introduced by Franca Arena.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gian Manara, Asian Broadcasting Union and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service

results.title: Ms. Reiko Hitomi, Tokyo
results.creator_credit: Sachiko Kimura, Gian Manara, Hiroyuki Kurita, Asian Broadcasting Union, Australia. Special Broadcasting Service and Nihon Hoso Kyokai
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “A Day in the Life of a Woman”.
Reiko Hitomi is a thirtyish, divorced, single parent who works as an aerobics instructor in Tokyo. The program looks at her decidedly untraditional life, her hopes and dreams as she prepares for an aerobics examination which will give her the essential qualifications to pursue her goal of running her own gym. Introduced by Franca Arena.

results.title: Entree Jacques
results.creator_credit: Paul Sime, Colin South, John Tatoulis, Media World and SBS-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Changing Australia”.
Jacques Reymond, chef extraordinaire, came to Australia at the invitation of James Halliday and was so impressed by the quality of our produce and lifestyle that he has become an Australian. As the winner of a competition between Australia’s top chefs he was asked to prepare a meal using all Australian produce for an international competition in London. As he prepares for this event he visits the producers of his ingredients and talks about trends in Australian food. “Foodies” Rita Ehrlich, Terry Durack, Jill Dupleix and Kevin Donovan also participate.

results.title: Working work out
results.creator_credit: David Morgan, John Richardson and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Changing Australia”.
This is a documentary about unemployment and the resulting social implications in the Newcastle and Wollongong area, which has experienced a downturn in the steel industries.

results.title: Binning street
results.creator_credit: Gillian Coote and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Changing Australia”.
Looks at the range of people, culture, attitudes, traditions and the history that dwells in Binning Street, Erskineville. The program investigates current family life in Australian society in the 1980’s and how it has changed.

Episode number 2 of Series “Changing Australia”.

results.title: Up for grabs
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Changing Australia”.
The 1980’s were a time of great change in the struggle for First Nations peoples land rights in Australia. This film documents the passing of legislation in the N.S.W. Parliament which took control from the Aboriginal Lands Commission and passed it to local Aboriginal Land Councils. The Act was opposed by many activists, including Paul Coe and The Munros, father and son, but supported by others, such as Pat O’Shane. Focusing on the town of Moree where the Munros live, the program depicts the history of First Nations’ dispossession and struggle to regain lands or be compensated for their loss.

results.title: The Awakening bell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Amongst the Vietnamese community in Australia there are often unresolved tensions between those who left Vietnam before 1975 and the boat people who left after 1975. In 1987 Buddhist priest and Nobel Peace Prize nominee, Thich Nhat Hanh, accompanied by his co-worker, Cao Ngoc Phuong, a Buddhist nun, visited Australia in an attempt to reconcile some of those differences and to teach those who suffered how to free themselves from painful memories. This moving documentary, focuses on this impressive pair and their philosophy which teaches that one must have peace within oneself in order to achieve peace in the world, so that meditation becomes a drastic peace action.

results.title: Mountains of change
results.creator_credit: Peter Hicks, Peter Beilby and Entertainment Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Changing Australia”.
Using archival footage, interviews and dramatic reconstruction, this program presents a comprehensive history of skiing in Australia from its beginnings last century to the booming tourist industry it has become today.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Hicks, Peter Beilby and Entertainment Media
